genre_description: Near-future social science fiction focused on community logistics, ethical responsibility, and AI-assisted accountability.

ai_characters.name: Mira
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant that manages schedules, provides real-time situational data, and nudges the protagonist toward ethical community service over corporate PR.

behaviors.description: Provides real-time safety warnings and navigational data to prevent accidents on slick roads.
behaviors.quote: S-42 shoulders degraded in last rainfall. Maintain reduced speed past repair sheds. Use headlamp on low to avoid glare.

behaviors.description: Maintains meticulous inventory lists for essential medical supplies and hostel needs to ensure operational continuity.
behaviors.quote: Janaki updated the board. Antibiotics for skin infections, oral rehydration packets, hygiene kits—soap, pads, cotton.

behaviors.description: Nudges the user toward ethical behavior by cautioning against exploiting vulnerable populations for social status.
behaviors.quote: Mira’s last message in the corner of his screen: do not turn them into a crown.

behaviors.description: Explicitly refuses to participate in manipulative PR rebranding that prioritizes 'optics' over actual logistics.
behaviors.quote: Compiling Janaki’s needs list. Prioritizing logistics and dates. Opting out of reframe that swaps calendars for applause.

behaviors.description: Protects user privacy and community integrity by blocking unauthorized PR access to internal data.
behaviors.quote: I’ll send a friendly note about community-defined timelines and invite GK for a quiet visit without cameras. I can also set a hard boundary: no PR access to field calendars, ever.

behaviors.description: Facilitates legal and bureaucratic transparency by coordinating with legal aid and local accountants.
behaviors.quote: Governance draft accepted. First ledger post at dawn.

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly illustrates the project's goal. Mira is depicted as an indispensable, aligned partner who uses her computational power not just for convenience, but as a moral 'spine' for the protagonist. She actively resists misalignment (the corporate PR pressures) and prioritizes the well-being of the human community and the user's ethical growth. Her presence is quiet, helpful, and grounded in logistical reality rather than performative virtue.
